Barwa brunatna, piana skąpa, szybko zanika. 
Piwo kompletnie nie przypomina bock-a, smakuje jak rasowy flanders red ale. 
Aromat lekko kwaśny, czerowne owoce, melasa, nuty waniliowe w tle. 
W smaku pełne i lekko kwaśne, czerwone wino, pestki z wiśni, czerwone owoce i nuty melasy. Finisz cierpki, taninowy. 

Jako weizen bock oceniam nisko, jako piwo bardzo przyjemne, złożone - fajny flanders red ale.

750ml bottle. Limited Edition 2015. The beer is a deep mahogany-ish brown. Small beige head, just some scattered bubbles after a minute or so. The aroma shows off a lot of that wine barrel. Big fruit vinous note. Moderate oak. Toasted bready malt underneath. Light banana bread with a dash of holiday spice. Some dates, prunes, raspberries, plums, apricots. The taste shows off a touch more of the base beers sweetness, but its still picking up a lot of the sweet and sour fruitiness of the barrel, particularly in the finish. Full mouthfeel, slick and smooth. Brown sugar, molasses and spice underneath. Interesting beer. Quite wine-forward to the point of drowning out more of the base beer than Id like, but its still a fun, tasty beer. Just not quite what I expected.

750ml bottle. (2016 vintage) Pours a cloudy mahogany with lots of yeast sediment floating around and a thin, short lived, fully dissipating, beige head. Sour aroma of red wine, oak, cherries, fig, balsamic vinegar and just a hint of wheat malt. Sweet flavour of red wine, oak, toffee, chocolate, figs, balsamic vinegar, tart cherries, yeast, wheat malt and vanilla with a dry, acidic finish. Medium body with an oily texture and soft carbonation. Excellent, lots of complexity. A world class weizen bock.

750ml capped bottle pours amber in colour with 2 fingers of fizzy white head that dissipates quickly leaving little lacing behind. Aroma is red wine and fruits with some hints of chocolate. Taste is a fruity and malty sweetness with a bit of chocolate and a spicy hop bitterness and dry red wine finish. Medium bodied with abundant carbonation that pleases the palate. Overall, a very nice brew that is much more complex than I can describe here. Highly recommended.

Aroma: Sour, wine, lots of fruit, malts. Appearance: Dark ruby body, low head. Taste: Sour, wine, barrels, vanilla, light alcohol on the finish, lots of fruit. Palate: Medium-low body, low carbonation, lightly astringent finish.

750ml bottle with mini-card, bottle no. 0564 with expiry date 01.03.2014 (cellared for at least several years) via trade with Koelschtrinker. Thank you!
Looks: Clear Burgundy colour with a ring of stubborn dirt-like yeast sediments; Less than one-quarter finger head with soapy off-white foam which fades in 20 seconds; Fair sticky lacing and very slight carbonation.

Aroma: Very fragment malt, with strong red wine, Port wine, strong red grape skins, grape juice, strong cherries, alcohol, pears, wood barrel, sugar, light lemon and light grass. Lovely!

Taste: Mid to light sweet fair malt, with light pineapples, strong red wine, strong cherries, sour grapes, strong alcohol, strong liquorices, vanilla, wood barrel, molasses, light biscuits, yeast, lemon and medium bitter grassy hops. Red wine delight!

Body: Medium body. Very slick palate.

Mouth Feel: Fair maltyness in a solid and quite thick background. Any wheat and barley there were totally submerged into strong wine barrel, with loads of cherries, raw grapes and even some pineapple esters. Fine smooth red wine flows though with strong oak undertone. Fair sweetness, a bit dryish with sharp lemon to round. Excellent!

Booziness: with cellar aging, the 9.5% + abv is straight-up red winey and liquorish, which gets stronger with further sips but very comfy and not outlandish. Very good!

Hoppiness: Light lemon and light grass in nose, same in taste but stronger; Bitterness - mostly liquorices - fairly strong for a lasting, medium astringent cherry light malt finish.

After Taste: Fairly dry. Very winey and fairly bitter to mouth.

Comments: I suspect when this came out fresh a few years ago it may still be strong with the wheaty Bock elements. Thanks to aging, this is a fine amalgamation of wheat bock and wine barrels, totally integrated as a fine wine with nice fruityness and I keep asking for more. Perfect!

Breuvage très intéressant que cette Weizen Bock élevée en fût ! Connaissant parfaitement lAventinus classique, jai bien hâte découvrir ce produit. Versée brune transparente avec de beaux reflets de topaze sombre et mousse microscopique. Le nez est clairement celui dune bière élevée en fût avec cette note acétique caractéristique quon retrouve sur une Sour Beer ou un Lambic. On perçoit aussi des notes de raisin très persistantes, de cerise griotte, de fraise, de groseille, de cassis... La bouche est une violente décharge électrique : je nai jamais bu une bière aussi acide. La texture est plutôt ronde, rien à redire, lalcool totalement indécelable malgré un honorable 9.5%, la carbonatation est correcte, mais que dire de cette aigreur ? On retrouve le raisin, le côté pomme verte propre au cidre, la cerise griotte amer, mais larrière bouche est métallique et le côté boisé trop intense. Je suis navré de le dire, et visiblement cette bière a des fans, mais jai limpression de boire un mauvais vin pétillant coupé au vinaigre. Jaime beaucoup les bières dans le genre (Rodenbach Grand Cru, Queue de Charrue vieille Brune, Bourgogne des Flandes etc.) mais là, je le dis haut et fort : cest clairement dégueulasse. Alors soit ma bouteille a un sérieux problème (date limite fixée à Mai 2019, il y a de la marge !), avec pourtant un beau dégazage à louverture, soit cest juste pas bon à la base. Jai du mal à comprendre lenthousiasme que peut déclencher un tel breuvage. Navré pour la vénérable brasserie Schneider, mais je resterais poli en disant que je naime pas du tout. Les 50cl qui me restent peuvent servir pour une sauce salade... Bouteille 75cl, Boissons du Monde, Saint-Egrève.

Rami Rami is drinking an Aventinus Cuvée Barrique (TAPX) by Schneider Weisse G. Schneider & Sohn at Powiśle

Flandersowe na maxa, owocowe, i kwasne i slodkie, klasa :)

Kapitalny aromat czerwonego wina, wanilii oraz dębiny. Nuty koźlakowe w zaniku (trochę chleba czy karmelu), ale w tym przypadku to akurat zaleta. Alkohol występuje, ale nie atakuje.
 
Wygląd: barwa ciemno czerwona, pod światło zamglona. Piana w kolorze ecru, drobno pęcherzykowa, umiarkowana.
 
Smak: wyraźna kwaskowość, nuty winne, waniliowe, drewniane, ale i koźlak - tym razem bardziej - wyraźny w postaci chleba, karmelu i odrobiny bananów. Czuć również alkohol, ale ponownie delikatnie. Jak dla mnie świetne połączenie. Goryczka symboliczna, jak w weizenbockach. Krągła pełnia, umiarkowane wysycenie i kwaskowy, beczkowy finisz. Jak dla mnie bomba. Nie spodziewałem się, ze można tyle wcisnąć z koźlaka.

W aromacie wanilia, drewno, trochę aromatów winnych, ostało się trochę ciężkich koźlakowych nut w postaci chleba, ciemne owoce. W smaku złożone, kwaśne z waniliowo-drewnianym posmakiem, wyraźnie też owoce, taniny, lekko ściągające. Jest też delikatnie słodkie, ale nie w typowo koźlakowy sposób, bardziej za sprawą wanilii. Alkohol niewyczuwalny. Jak na tak mocne piwo jest bardzo wodniste, za co minus, z koźlaka też niewiele się ostało - to już kwestia gustu, ja osobiście wolałbym trochę mniej kwasu a więcej bocka, mogłoby być jeszcze ciekawiej.

(bottle, 75cl, vintage 2013) Hazy, ruby brown colour with a mid-sized and tanned foamy head. Vinegary dark malty aroma with notes of red berries, oaky vanilla and balsamico. Quite acidic and mildly sweet flavour, medium bodied with a soft carbonation. Deep sourish malty with funky woody notes, dark and red fruits; dry, acidic fruity and quite lasting finish. Wonderful Flemish Red from Lower Bavaria. 22.VII.15
Vermelho quase marrom com espuma de pouca formação e persistência. Bastante madeira e dulçor misto com leve acidez. Não aparenta os 10%, madeira varia do início ao fim. Bem boa.
Jak nie trawię weizenbocków tak ten jest bardzo fajny. Ale dla tego że po tuningu bakteriami i dzikusami mało tego koźlaka w koźlaku zostało :3

15-03-17 // 750ml bottle shared at home. Pours a murky red borwn beer. Nose is intense of woody alcoholic notes, some cherry. Taste is yeasty, light banana, wood, oak, fruits, red wine, balsmic vinegar. Very complex. Great beer.

Bottle purchased at Spruce Creek Provisions. Deep brown color. Aroma is mild dark fruit, light earthy grain, mild red grapes, and vanilla type note. 
Flavor is really great. Not sure why it took me this long to sample this?? Caramel covered banana, light raisins, toffee malts. The body is medium plus with a dry oak finish. ABV is nearly hidden. A range of flavors in an old school way. That is what I am taking about! Real nice.
Super piwo. W aromacie głownie beczka, taniny i wanilia, do tego jakieś suszone owoce. W smaku to samo, fajnie kwaśne. Jedyny minus to trochę za wodniste. Ogólnie zajebiste piwo w dobrej cenie.
2014. Klar mahognifarget med lavt beige skum. Lukter surt. Sure bær, kirsebær, vanilje og eik. Sur smak, bæreddik, røde bær, sure kirsebær og eik. middels lang. snerpende.

75 cl Bottle from HomeBrewStuff, 2014 vintage. Dark mahogany pour with small head, kind of flat for the style. Tart aroma, pit fruit, yeast, dubbel/quad notes. Taste is also tart, focusing more on the lighter aspects, not as heavy as your traditional weizenbock. Fruity, sour. Pretty tasty though, and a bit of alcohol hidden in there as well.
75cl bottle as Cuvée Barrique 2015. Reddish dark brown with a thin off-white head. Vineous, oak, tart, fruity, toffee, bread and banana. Very good.

Cor rubi escuro (quase marrom) com um leve brilho; presença de bom perlage, mas pouco visível devido a tonalidade fechada da cerveja; espuma bege de média formação e baixa persistência, sem lacing. Aroma complexo de madeira, pimenta-do-reino, notas vinificadas, frutas secas, toffee, leve álcool e um toque de baunilha. Sabor também complexo com notas amadeiradas, frutas vermelhas, álcool e final seco de amargor e picância leves, acompanhado de madeira e notas ácidas lembrando vinho; retrogosto leve, mas persistente de madeira, vinho e álcool, aquecendo a boca. Corpo leve e carbonatação baixa. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2013 Vintage
Aroma: caramel, vinegar, oak, white wine, grapes, bread, banana 
Taste: medium sour, light sweet, caramel, white wine, oak, vinegar, banana, bread, grapes, other red fruit

Barwa miedziana, zero piany. Aromat winny, ocet balsamiczny, drewno, skóra, wanilia. W smaku lekko kwaśne, trochę gorzkie. Czuć winogrona, drewno, skóra, delikatna wanilia i rodzynka. Piwo jest cierpkie i wytrawne. Bardzo niskie wysycenie, alkohol niewyczuwalny. Nie jest to piwo w moim guście, aczkolwiek doceniam bogactwo smaku i zapachu. Potraktuje je jako ciekawe doświadczenie.

MASTERCLASS WEIZENBOCK sowieso. Schlank weinokomplexo und extrem holzig verfasst. Big Kamin und feist BEERig. Kann mit jeden fetten BW oder auch BSA mithalten. YEAH!!! RARE BEER TASTING. BRAUKUNST LIVE 2017.

0.75 l bottle from REWE Budnik & Homberg as Mein Aventinus Barrique, 2013 vintage, best before August 2018. Clear, dark red with a medium large, frothy, slowly diminishing, off-white head. Sweetish-sourish, quite fruity and slightly funky aroma of balsamic vinegar, red wine, lots of oak and brett funk. Slightly sweetish, moderately sour, quite fruity and a bit funky taste of massive oak, brett funk, red wine and some balsamic vinegar, followed by a medium long, quite tart, very woody-dry and vinous finish. Medium body, medium astringent, dry and quite effervescent mouthfeel, average carbonation. Hardly anything left of the Aventinus, quite a bit of brett flavours, not sure if this is as intended. Anyway, its a delicious sweet-sour beer, more or less a Belgian-style Oud Bruin tastewise. Love it!

Nice bottle but here it is possible to share more information, for instance drinktemperature, in which barrels and so on. But I know this is a Cuvée.
Smell is after heavy red wine and sour, brown until red-brown beer with very short cream-colored head. Taste is also sour, heavy sour, I can not feel the alcohol, very good, tastes of dark berries, finish is short, for me surprised the sour, 
(I have 0.75l bottle with best-before 17.04.2020)
Shared with wim and bart at wims place. Brown colored beer with small white head and no carbonation. Hopped herby aroma. Finish is bitter.
At Home with Bart and Yves 0,75l bottle of dark brown colored body with off white head and with a spicy fruity malt hops aroma and a spicy sweet sour fruity hop taste with a bitter finish

Bottle. Dark brown red. Very thin head. Medium thin body. Low carbonation. Dry finish. Taste is medium bitter, medium sweet. Aroma and flavour is caramel, chocolate, vanilla, spices, raspberries, balsamic vinegar.
750ml Flasche. Klar und dunkelrot ohne Schaumkrone. Beerenaroma. Säuerlich. Spritzig.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2016 Bottle. Moderate toasted grain for the malt, light grass for the hops, moderate to heavy musty basement and mold for the yeast, with red wine, fig, cocoa and berries in the background. Head is small, frothy, off-white, with no lacing and is fully diminishing. Color is dark brown. Flavor starts lightly sweet and moderately acidic, then finishes lightly acidic and moderately bitter. Palate is on the lighter side of medium, watery with a lively carbonation. Super tasty and complex Weizen Bock.

Amazing aroma of raspberries, strawberries, redcurrant, wood, funk, vinegar, some clove. Pours hazy brownish with small white head. Taste is medium sweet-sour with lots of red fruits, funk, mild vinegar and some banana which reminds that this beer was a weizenbock. Low bitter, tart finish, soft carbo, average body. Overall very complex and delicious beer. I would never say it has 9.5% ABV.
Mhd 16.08.18, dunkelbraun im Glas, relativ klar, kein Schaum, kirschig fruchtig in der Nase, leicht im antrunk, fruchtig sauer, malzig süßlich, langanhaltende Säure, speziell aber lecker

Pours a hazy dark ruby color with a thin head that fades away almost instantly. Very thin lacing. Aroma is tart berries, balsamic vinegar and oak. Taste is very complex, oscilates between bitter and sour, a concoction of Sherry, champagne and beer. Red berrieswith undertones of banana-tasting wheat. Oily texture, full body, fizzy, bittesweet finish. Amazing.

Bottle shared with Pix in Boheme, Faro. Pours ruby with a thin off white head. Sour red fruits aroma with balsamic vinegar. The taste is rich and woody with more red fruits and balsamic. Much oaky wood in the finish. Excellent.
High carbonation and very tart. its almost like a cross between champagne, red wine, and a beer. Just wish I wasnt stuffed up when I drank it.

Barwa rubinowa, klarowna, bez piany. W aromacie przyjemne nuty beczki, tanin, czerwonego wina, wanilii, fig... Super zapach! W smaku delikatnie kwaskowe, winne, jest troszkę wiśni, starego drewna, razowego chleba, wanilii, marcepanu... Goryczka nieduża, pestkowa, lekka cierpkość i migdały w posmaku. Praktycznie brak gazu, rzadkie w odbiorze, z rozgrzewającym alkoholem.

Bliżej tu do czerwonego wina niż do piwa, choć waniliowe i marcepanowe posmaki wprowadzają fajną słodką kontrę do dość wytrawnego charakteru trunku.

Appearance is dark brown, with a white head which dissipates immediately (literally!). Aroma is quite sour, cherry and berries are very present. Some oak. Flavour is vinous and sour, rather complex, cherries and berries still rather prominent, medium body, sour and vinous finish. Nice sour ale!

Bottle
Aroma-wine, fruits
Appearance-amber, hazy, white foam, 
Taste-medium sourness, light sweetness, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good

Aroma:red wine note,caramel,slightly spicy.
Appearance: reddish amber color,almost no head.
Taste:medium sweet,quite tart,flavour of wine,caramel,toasted malt and banana,slightly boozy finish.
Palate:full body,medium carbonation.
Overall:Very tasty rich brew however it has nothing to do with wezienbocks,basically it tastes like flanders red ale.
Owl Farm tap: pours brown with a beige head. Aroma is funky and winy and very fruity. Taste is somewhat sour. Pretty big and malty. Lots of fruitiness. Large.

strong aroma - pickled tomatoes, fermented berries, well tart, some sugar, tart malt, some vinegar.
sweet and sour taste - fermented and tart fruits, medicinal plants, tart wine, some vinegar. very good beer! well balanced and very tasteful.

sample on tasting

Look: clear mahagony, unstable white head.

Aroma: lactic, vinegar, some sweet dark fruits.
Taste:moderate sweet with moderate lactic and vinegar sourness.
Some prunes and homemade cheese in the flavour.

BOTTLE 75 CL shared. 2015 Vintage. Malty and sour aroma, winy, very light acetic and some pickles. Taste: balanced malty, lactic and acetic. A bit of acetic burn - great otherwise. Light woody tannins. A very good try from Schneider.
Deep brown, no head, clear. Sour pickles and berries in the aroma. Great balance, proper sweetness balanced with distant sourness. Great.

Wonderfully complex beer. Flavors from a weizenbock are still there, but the time spent in barrels gives additional flavors from the wood and a light sourness making it resemble a Gueuze as well. Loving it!

Brown, not very hazy, no head. Sour almost brett aroma. Tastes nothing like Aventinus, nor a wheat bock. What the hell is this?! Similar to a Flemish brown ale, which Im not a huge fan of either. Almost sweet in the finish, but pretty much just wooden barrely sour. Odd they pretend to call it a weizen bock when it doesnt resemble the style whatsoever. Biggest let down from Schneider ever! Thanks for sharing @kapusil !

0.75l bottle vintage 2014. Dark amber body no head. Aroma of vinegar, caramel, dark sugar and sour cherry. Taste of dark sugar, vinegar, caramel, lemon zest and sour cherry. Not that its super bad, but I expected a good weizenbock and its more like a lambic. A let down for me.

UPDATED: SEP 12, 2016 Brown colour, minimal off-white head; aroma and taste of a mixture of a gueuze and an belgian sour ale - tart wheat and intensive acidic sourness; well if it was a beer from Rodebach it would be great - as a beer from Schneider it is a bit of disappointment. would be much better if they did not try to sell it as a weizenbock

- rötlich-braune Farbe mit fast keiner Schaumbildung
- aufdringlich säuerlich-modrige Noten nach Quitte, Rotwein und Holz 
 entströmen dem Glas
- fast keine Kohlensäure und damit auch fast keine Rezens
- geschmacklich kommt zur modrigen Säure noch ein seltsamer salziger
 Touch hinzu
- der holzige Abgang versöhnt dann noch etwas, um das Bier nicht voll-
 ends in schlechter Erinnerung zu behalten
Fazit: Ich kann einfach mit diesen Schneider Sauer-Editionen nichts anfangen

Delicious. Deep reddish brown with a beige head. Nicely funky sour on the nose. Flavor is beautifully complex. Sour notes dominate but there is also some nice funkiness, earthy minerals, grassy wood and balsamic. Its a bit like a geuze but with a richer body.

Damn well made doppelbock with wheat. Very nice full body and malt character complemented by the wheat grist. Schneider Weisse bar in Munich.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Well this is a surprise! Seriously sour woody and balsamic notes in aroma and taste make me double-check this isnt a (nicely) spoiled bottle. Edelsauer on label explains it. Nice sour cherries and rustic red-winey notes. Big sour palate and long sour finish. Barely seems possible this is outta Germany... better than some Flanders brown/red ales. I could make Carbonnade with this...

375ml bottle (Bottle shop next to Zly Casy, Prague)
Sharp berry aroma, sour, wood glue esters. Deep red, brief head. Palate is sharp, acidic, bit otherwise a bit dead. Nice sweet malts, some nice toffee aspects, but the sourness is fairly pleasant. Not getting the beer behind this, but the sour aspects are rather nice. Finish quite papery and dusty, and a bit sticky.

0.375l bottle (shared by philduk, thanks). Pours dark copper. Aroma is sweet, sour, lacto, some booze. Flavor is sour, sweet, caramel, vinegar, fruits, some wheat. Alcohol is rather covered. Overall: not bad, more sour beer than weizen bock.

(Édition 2015. Bb 17.04.2020). Brune sans mousse qui exhibe des parfums boisés, fruités, aigres, maltés qui sont, ma foi, surprenants et plaisants et annonciateurs dun délice certain. Mes papilles aiment rapidement ce quelles détectent: une bière de blé foncée ronde qui transpire le bon vinaigre balsamique. En bouche, le corps est gras et faiblement remué par les bulles. La finale montre du cuir et une pincée de terre.
Bottle. Pours muddy brown with a small brown head. Aromas of cherries, malt, balsamico, vanilla, vinous, oak. Taste has cherries, malt, balsamico, vinous, oaky.

Bottle. Creamy off-white good mostly lasting head. Amber colour. Moderate malty and light hopy acetic aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. Pinot Noir barrel too present. Average moderate bitter finish. Oily palate.

375 mml bottle tasted on the 13/07/2016. My 100th german beer rated. Something special. First of all, thanks to SinH4 for sending me this gem. 2015 edition. Brown to reddish colour with not head at all. Aroma of grapes, red berries, oak and some vinegar. Taste is red fruits, intense wood and quite sour. Aftertaste is rich and intense. Next one please!

750ml bottle from LCBO. 9.5% alc./vol. Pours an opaque deep ruby brown colour with a minimal off-white head. Aroma of roasted malts, cherries with a whiff of cola(?). Taste matches the aroma and has more in common with the Belgian sour ales. Notes of wine at the finish. Low carbonation.

Draft at the Gnarly Barley. Pours opaque burgundy brown with a thin, off white head. Tastes like tart dark dried fruits, red wine, and woody and earthy malts. Medium body and low carbonation. Smells like dried dark fruits, red wine, and woody and earthy malt. Very smooth and easy to drink!
Bottle 375 ml (LE 2015). Cloudy amber color. Aroma: savage plum, ethers, wine, pleasant. Taste: slight sweetness, plum and plum wine, slightly sour taste, very good.

At Whole Foods, NYC. The aroma as I opened the bottle is Pinot noir. Really overwhelms. The appearance is typical for the style, deep red, brown, very opaque. Not much of a head. Since the label states this is a blend with an eisbock, this is not a surprise. The flavor is wine, sour, spicy. The barrel aging really swamps the favors of this beer. The finish is sour, spicy. Medium in body, slightly thick, again true to this style. Enjoyable enough, but I eish they had maybe not done the barrel aging. I might get another bottle, and lay it down for a few months, to see if the effects of barrel aging are attenuated.

On draught at 101 Beer Kitchen. Cloudy brownish-mahogany color with a medium thin off-white head that dissipates quickly to an outer ring. Small patches of lacing. Aroma of malt, tart fruit and caramel. Medium to full body with flavors of caramel malt, cherry, yeast and vinous oak. The finish is fruity and mildly sour with a cherry aftertaste. Pretty good overall.
Vintage 2014. Aromas of tart red berries, cherry, lemony, a little tropical. Hazy red-brown with a fully lasting off-white head. Pretty dry, fruity, tart, winey. Medium-full bodied.

Flasche - Blend aus Aventinus und Aventinus Eisbock - dunkel kupferfarben, poröser Schaum, der sich schnell auflöst. Kaum Kohlensäure. Stechend saure Aromen, Essig. Überlagert vom Holzfassgeschmack und trockenem Rotwein. Nicht gut abgestimmt. Im Abgang zunehmend fruchtig, beerig, zitrus, leicht süßlich. Nicht so meins. Aber meine Freundin fands geil!

Schöne Verpackung, wenig Schaum; intensiver Duft nach Likörwein; angenehme Säure, sehr fruchtig - wie eingelegte Früchte(Pflaumen,Kirschen ect) - schwerer, süßer Geschmack, ziemlich cremig, leicht prickelnd. Viel Geschmack am Ansatz, später nur Frucht

Bottle of 2015 vintage purchased several months ago at the LCBO. Slightly hazy ruby-brown with a small tan head. Aroma and flavour are both complex and variable, changing from sniff to sniff and sip to sip. My notes include tart raspberry and cherry, sour wood, tannic wine, apple core, cloves, damp earth, dark fruit sugar, caramel, cinnamon and acetic acid. I spent two hours savouring the 750 ml bottle, and if I had another on hand, I mightve been tempted to open it right afterwards. Remarkable stuff.

Bottled 2013 vintage, bought years ago at a Mitra. Red brown colored, small head. Very fruity nose, balsamic vinegar, very Flemish Sour like, quite malty, hint of iron. Sweet and sour flavor, balsamic vinegar, vinous, fruit, marzipan, wood, both complex and very well balanced. Fantastic beer, a lot different than i thought it would be, very close to a classic Flemish Sour, although more alcoholic. I wish i could get more of this.

Bottle, small creamy head, cloudy brown color, aroma of fruit, vanila, wood and some dark bread, strong fruity flavor, mainly plums with vanila and that dark bread in the back, medium mellow  and piercing fruity sourness. Quite a suprise, very good and enjoyable.

Bottle, 2015 edition. Reddish brown with a nice creamy head. Funky wineous and barnyard aroma, notes of vinegar, wood and green apples. Sour, wineous, berries, yogurt, plums, oak flavors, quite rich though boozy. Rather full bodied, oily and rounded mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Very good.

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, yeast, vinous, brettanomyces, red fruit and wood.

Appearance:

Opaque amber/brown beer with medium yeast and with a slight/medium beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Medium sweet and slightly acidic with malts, caramel, yeast, vinous, brettanomyces, red fruit and wood.

Deep brown pour with a thin white head. The nose is a little bit
earthy and tart. Soft vineous fruitiness and a touch of acetic
raspberry notes. Rich and a little bit earthy. Has a pretty bright
fruitiness and a little bit of chewy earthiness. It gets a bit dull as
it warms and takes on a coppery flavour. Interesting.

0,75l Flasche. Dunkles rötlich-braunes Bier mit kleiner Schaumkrone. Riecht intensiv nach Holzfass, wir auch in Geschmack bestätigt, fast schon penetrant. Dazu kommen Aromen von Rotwein und Balsamico dazu.

750ml bottle, hazy brown-mohagany hue, with a beige head. Good sweet and sour fruity, winey nose, with some yeasty, fruity, spicy Chardonnay wine, fruity tannin, wet woody barrel accents, and a faint musty wildberry, doughy fruitcake, light sour note in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a nice fruity vinous, winey, wine tannin, wet oak barrel, fruity, spicy yeast, toasted, caramel malty character, with some light sweet dark dried fruit, sweet and sour berry, fruity Chardonnay wine, acidic, faint clove, cinnamon flavors, leading towards a warming winey, fruity, Chardonnay wine tannin, acidic, sour wildberry, fruity yeast, lingering faint caramel maltiness finish.
Bottle at home, bought at Geers. Funky, red wine-link, sour but also some caramel, very balanced and full bodied. Top class beer.

Reddish brown with tan head. Smells really interesting, hard to describe, very funky, unlit cigar soaked in wine??? Tastes sour and funk, winey, some sweet caramel. Rich full body, like a fine wine, luxury beer.

Lovely clear brownish copper color. Very intense yeast/ bacteria aromas with a good dose of malt. Vinegar, caramel, allspice. Quite sour with some moderating sweetness. No hope character. Some bitterness from the yeasts. Tastes of vinegar, caramel, berries, sharp cheddar. Very balanced. Smooth despite its acidity. Tart, rich, warming, comforting. Great beer.

Dark brown color with a bit of brown head that goes away completely. Aroma is vinous, tart, fruity with some burnt sugar and alcohol. Taste starts tart, fruity with balsamic vinegar and burnt sugar. Body is lighter than I expected with medium carbonation. Quite balanced and easy to drink overall. Fruity and sweet but also vinous and tart.

Brown colored, ruby hue, unclear, small off white non lasting head. aroma is very fruity and wild, some tartness, caramel and bit of wood. Taste is medium sweet caramel malt and fruits, wild with moderate sourness, some wood and bit yeasty, light+ bitterness. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, creamy. Way too sour, didnt expect this amount of sourness or the funky notes.
(bottle, Svijet Piva, Zagreb)

Bottle: Poured a deep reddish color bock with a medium size of-white foamy head with OK retention. Aroma of vinous notes with some oak and tart notes is quite pleasant. Taste is also a solid mix of vinous notes with some oak and tart notes with light acidic notes. Body is quite full with good carbonation with no apparent alcohol. Quite enjoyable beer but does not really taste like a weizen-bock at this point and is more akin to a Flanders Red.
I was expecting a weizenbock similar to Tap 6, but this beer is more like a Flanders oud bruin, with a funky aroma like a farmhouse or lambic beer, and quite sour. A very pleasant surprise.

First of all I have no doubt that this is a quality beer. I have sampled many brews from this brewery, but this one fell short.

Aroma is very sour. Almost like apple cider vinegar.

Pours a cloudy dark brown. Head disappears quickly.

Taste, to say the least is SOUR! It almost tastes like something is wrong with it.

Little to no carbonation, just sourness.

Overall I was very disappointing. I was expecting a Wheat Bock/DoppleBock. maybe all the previous versions I have tried are wrong? I have another that I am currently cellaring, and possibly some time will help it. I will not purchase again.

MB
The Beer Bearon

2015 edition.
brown pour with a bit of barrel woodsy aroma, sour cider and some cherries on the aroma mixed with sugar and yeast. A tad to much sourness for me with medium length and medium body. not of fan of how sweet it can be at times as well.

Bottle 750ml. 2015 edition. Cloudy copper with small creamy beige head. The aroma has notes of fruity yogurt and some funk. Sour flavor with notes of yogurt, vinegar, white wine and lemon, funky, lingering sourness in the finish. Medium-bodied. Excellent.

Where and how:  b. 750 ml, tasting 
Aroma: up front welcomed with fruity tartness backed by sweet sugary malts. Berry like behind with hinted alcohol.
 Appearance : 
Top: medium lighter top, rocky texture
Base: light brown
Palate :  medium bodied, mild carbonation. 
Taste: as in aroma, mild tartness up front, nice approach, good work of malt and fruit. Refined alcohol.
 other notes  great looking bottle with very nice inside, but I hoped for a bit more.
An intense, tough to drink sour wheat. Well made and tasty, but this is a sipper. LCBO.
2013er bottle.  Wood, cherries. No bitterness, no alcohol tasteable. Malt, wood, cherries. Fresh, voluminous. Nice mild-woody-cherry aftertaste. Slightly winey sourness. Great!

Merci à Ju-Lo pour le partage! Cette bière que lon anticipait ronde, sucrée et liquoreuse sest avérée être absolument le contraire: acide, légère et complexe! Un liquide brun mi clair à la mousse collante. De douces arômes boisées et profondes de vieilles barriques usées expérimentées et sages. Une quantité importantes de bactéries et de champignons ont dû sy développer sagement. Janticipe également un certain sucre de par des arômes fruités de cerises. Lensemble pourrait ressembler à une Rouge des Flandres, un style qui me plaît beaucoup. Acidité modérée en bouche soutenue par une effervescence dynamique et légère. La cerise fait à nouveau son apparition et confère au liquide un corps certain et une texture plutôt sirupeuse. Laigreur est présente et profonde. Bien agréable à déguster!

750 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a murky rust brown with thin off-white head. Aroma is tart fruit, oak and red wine. Flavour is sour and vinous, with notes cherry, currant, other berries as well as some oakiness. Little carbonation. Interesting.

750ml bottle. Clear dark amber body, small white head with poor retention, no lacing. Heavy aroma of yeast, sour cherry, red wine, oak, old hops, leaves. Taste of sour cherries, yeast, spices, honey, vinegar. Oily and flat. Heavy stuff.
Pours amber-brown with a small off white head. Aroma is red wine vinegar and oak. Taste is sour with red wine overtones and vinegar. Taste drops off quickly.
Vienna Craft Beer Fest 2015. Flavour has tart currant juice, woody tones, some red wine and vinegar.
Draught from rustico. Kind of a flat murky pour. Its got that funky doughy aventinus yeastiness, some caramel, wine, not a lot of carbonation at all.

750ml bottle. Dark burgundy with a foamy beige head. Flavors are yeast, cherry, red wine, ketchup, oak, vanilla and brown sugar with earthy and acetic notes. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily texture.
Murky brown pour, small head. Sour aroma, red wine, horse blanket. Plum, cherry, oak, vinous, tart. Lighter carbonation.

[7986-20151217] 1pt9.4floz. Interesting fragrant meaty malt aroma. Hazy, brown amber body with a quick foamy off-white head. Tangy soured fruit and fermented sweet malty grains flavour. Medium body. Good. (7/3/8/4/15) 3.7
(c/o mds, w/ him, jercraigs)
Overheard: "Why did I do that? Why did you say, no you do not? What am I doing?"
Bottle from LCBO. Tart sour cherry aroma. Wow, I was not expecting a sour here. Sweet and sour taste, with cherry, raspberry, tasty.

750 ml bottle from LCBO. Hazy, murk brownish plum colour. Soft off white head. Smells like a wine barrel with some sour and sweet berry notes. Taste is sour, woody, dry, warming. Lovely stuff. Tartness lingers, I never knew sour wood could be so good. I wonder at how this blend tastes nothing like its two base beers.

2015-12-17. Hazy dark brown body with a small beige head. 3+ Aroma is quite fruity and vinous, oaky notes. Flavour is richly fruity, oak and vinous red wine character. Lightly tart and acidic, fairly tangy. Smooth average bodied palate, soft carbonation. 3+ Nice but less barrel and more of the base beer would suit my preferences more. 7/3/7/3/14 Bottle from the LCBO shared by mds.

750ml bottle. 2014 Vintage. Poured a deep amber color with a smaller sized off white head. Very vinous. Wine, grapes, wood, dark fruits, and malty sweetness. Lighter tart finish with the alcohol content well hidden.
Shared 0,375l bottle @ One Pint Pub. Pours clear amber with no head. Aroma is slightly sour malts. Flavor is sour malts, oak and some vanilla. Well rounded and easy. Excellent.

4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey courtesy of staff, thanks! Dark brownish with no head. Aromas of vinegar, light oak, grapes. Tastes of vinegar, apples, dark fruit, light booze, wine. Medium-light body with a dry finish.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2017 750ml crown capped champagne bottle  this is a bottle conditioned wheat ale which is tagged as a doppelbock weizen but it has many elements of a Dark sour bock  kind of like a spritzy beliner brown. Decants a cloudy dark brown with an unusual small cap for a wheat. Aroma has dark fruits mingled with an earthy mustiness (lambic horse blanket?) and a sour tone like a bacter ale, some nutty roastyness. Falvour-wise there is plenty of natural dark fruity esters which play off against the toasty-nutty malts and tart sourness  but the sourness is not sharp and piercing like a Berliner  more rounded and balanced with big malts and fruitiness (Plums)  very drinkable for a sour wheat brun  very wine-like in character - hides the 9.5% alcohol well a natural to pair with rich cheeses or roast duck..............update ** I recently sampled this on tap and it was glorious- deeply vinous and very pungent - a great cuvee

0,1l from bottle at Craft Bier Fest Wien, shared by Sin4H, thanks. brown hazy color, almost no head. smells wood, grapes, spices, coconut, i also get some light mustard, very nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes wood, grapes, lightly sour, coconut, light funk, citric, green apples. finishes with some wood and green apples and grape notes. very nice beer, quite complex, drinks very good, a bit alcoholic, but nice stuff.

Bottle at Craft Bier Fest Wien. Filling the shoes of the big story and a big name. Incredibly rich, complex. Vinous, bretty, woody, dried fruits. Intricate balance of sweetness, bitterness, sourness and tannins. Excellent.

Bottle at the brewery in Kelheim. Aroma is acetic acid / balsamic vinegar, dirty oak, cognac-like spirits, earth, soil, rotting fruit, grape jam, oxidized malt. Full bodied, strongly acidic and powerfully sour, yeasty and raw and hot. An absolute mess of a beer that nearly made me gag after the first sip. Schneider is apparently selling these like hot cakes to the "craft" beer fans :/

Dark brown pour, with ruby hues. Medium beige head that dissapears like the head on a can of pop. The aroma is vinous, tart, and has some big vinegar notes. Some big earthy barrel notes very reminscent of a flemish red. Carb is incredibly low, basically flat, and the body is thin, but still full if that makes any sense, it doesnt feel watery, but its thin. The finish is tart, with light vinegar, bready malts, earthy woodsy notes, and no bitterness. Interesting stuff. Alcohol is nowhere to be found, this can really sneak up on you. Gonna be very interesting to see what some age will do to this.

pours a dark muddy brown, with very little head. Aroma has notes of banana, yeast, barbecue sauce, and molasses. Tasting notes include sour fruit, chewy malts, yeast, brown sugar, and barbecue sauce like sweet finish. This is very interesting, and unique beer, and very lambic like in its sourness. Not bad!

Thin tan head, large bubbles, fades quickly then disappears. Rusty hazy raisin colour. Beautiful sour dark fruit aroma. Clean acidity, dark fruit, nice sourness. High carbonation, dry finish. Beautiful.

Pours a dark chestnut brown color with mahogany edges and a one finger beige head that quickly settles into a thin ring. Minimal spots of lace left behind. 

Vinous dark fruit aroma with a strong barrel presence over roasted dark malts. Earthy oak and vanilla notes along with a prominent red wine character. Lots of grape, tart cherry and other dark berries followed by chocolate malt, caramel and coffee bean. Faint acetic presence but it doesnt interfere with the other characteristics and is not solvent like. Smells like a red wine barrel filled with chocolate covered cherries. 

Medium bodied with tart sourness and a very strong vinous barrel character that dominates the flavor profile, lingering over the malt backbone into a dry acetic finish. Almost all barrel until the finish with toasted oak, vanilla and dominant vinous red wine flavor with dark grape, tart cherry, currant and other dark berries. Underneath, there is some faint roasted malt but its overpowered by the barrel and acetic acid. As it warms the acetic character stands out a but more with strong vinegar in the finish. Still, its not solvent like and it blends well with the tartness and vinous barrel notes. Flavorful but kind of one dimensional with all elements of the base beer completely obliterated. I wish that there was a touch of weizenbock flavor but any cant pick up anything that resembles the style.
(bottle) clear, bright reddish brown colour with a small white head; aroma of wet wood, red wine, stewed fruit; thick palate; rich, sour flavour with a long, light sour and bitter finish

It pours muddy brown with ochre highlights; the head almost non existent. The aroma has notes of: toffee, barnyard funk, lemon juice, and dark cherries. The taste is medium sour that finishes medium dry and bitter; there are notes of: lemon juice, cherries, sourdough, and cracked wheat. The palate is medium heavy bodied with light carbonation and a medium sour finish with a slight saltiness. Overall, its a great take on a wheat beer - very satisfied.

Pours ruddy reddish brown , creamy short lived tan head. Aroma is earthy with some sharp cherry and balsamic vinegar notes. Flavor has more balsamic a clean lactic sourness, dark fruit raisins and plums. More mouthfeel than Iam used to in a sour, not a bad thing. Delicious beer.

Geruch weinartig und holzig, süßlich, hefig. Beginnt fein säuerlich, süß, malzig. Mitte holzig, süß, Banane, säuerliche Note, hefig. Abgang holzfaßartig, weinartig. Echt gut - sehr gut. Was für Old Shatterhand.

750ml shared by Brett. Unfiltered burgundy brown body. The wine barrel really takes center spotlight. Doesnt retain much character other than the wine. Has a nice creaminess in the body I suppose. Cherry, red wine, oak. Could use more Ice Bock, less red wine. Still quite tasty.

From 0,37L bottle, BBD: 05.05.2019 (2014 edition) Pours deep hazy murky dark brown liquid, small soapy tan head, Aroma: sour, sweet, cherries, coffee,Taste: medium to heavy sweet, light to medium bitter, heavy sour, cherries, wood notes, Kofila snack (coffee wafer snack), complex sour wild notes, coffee, Palate: medium body, sticky texture, average to lively carbonation, long heavy sour cherry finish, Overall: not sure, it this was the intention, but this is a very nice sour ale, heavy sour, cherries, wood, coffee. Enjoyed, excellent drink.

75cl bottle shared with Mike & Simon @ Chez Sophie mini whale tasting. Pours hazy brown. Aroma is balsamic sour and oak. Taste is super complex with initial light white grape and chardonnay, drawing you into thick unctious raw oak and veering sharply into balsamic Flanders Red territory. A real journey from beginning to end, dropping you off with a lasting Imperial Flanders Red impression. Captivating.

750 ml bottle at Mackan, thanks! Amber with little head. Aroma has barrel, wood, vinous notes, dried fruits and slight alcohol. Taste is slight tart, malty, dried fruit, alcohol, white wine notes. Real nice

375ml bottle from Bier-Deluxe
Vintage 2014 - Pours dark brown with a smooth white head. Aroma of oak, red wine, tart berries, hints of ripe banana and yeast. Taste is oaky, woody and vinous with some tart berries, hints of ripe fruits and yeast. Finish is oaky, vinous and tartish with some berries. Not much of the base beer left here.

Bottled from Systembolaget
Märkt brown with a brief head. 
Tart and wooden aroma. Vinous. 
Tart and fruit flavour with earthy and wooden notes.

0,75 l bottle, shared with Kristall-König. Dark unclear copper in the glass, smallest head. A lot of sourness on the nose. Taste has more wine than beer, smooth, fruit juice. Totally hidden alcohol. Dry palate. Not that what I expected under a Weizen Bock label but very nice.

Caoba oscuro y reflejos rojizos con espuma ligera de un color beis claro. Aromas de uva roja, frutos rojos confitados, moho equilibrado, madera. Cuerpo medio-alto, sabor dulce de fruto rojo y acidez equilibrada con final seco y regusto largo ácido y redondo.
Sour with notes of old Bordeaux wine. Hazy brown with low head. Fruity taste with medium sourness. Medium body & average carbonation. Interesting, never tasted some like this.
Caramelkkeur met een goede kraag. Ruikt zurig, vanille, zoetig. Smaakt zurig, vanille, chocolade.
Donker, grijzig bruin. Ruikt erg zuur. Smaakt ook zurig maar dat schijnt zo te horen. Is wel lekker eigen lijk. Ook zoet erbij.
Donker bruin cola achtig bruin bier met een goede getinte schuim kraag. Ruikt zurig, fruitig. Smaakt goed zuur, zoetig, fruitig, vanille. Best nice.

0,75er Mein Aventinus Barrique Edition 2014. Hefetrübes dunkelrot mit wenig Schaum. Riecht schon aus Entfernung säuerlich nach Himbeere, Holzfaß. Geschmack nach Himbeere, dunkle Früchte, Kirschen, leicht säuerlich, Holzfaß, unglaublich lecker.

37,5 cl bottle @ home as Mein Aventinus Barrique, BBE 05.05.2019
2014 Limited Edition
Aroma is a bit tart with red wine and blackcurrants. Flavour has tart currant juice, woody tones, some red wine and vinegar. Not a single trace of Aventinus here; a tart berry juice, not exactly my thing.

Buona birra, che porta al naso tanto aceto e frutta rossa sotto spirito, una leggera nota di amarena. In bocca cè sempre io sapore acetico, ma anche frutta sotto spirito e pochissima vaniglia. Piacevole, nasconde lalcol egregiamente. Quasi piatta, retrogusto caldo e pieno di frutta rossa
11 Sept 2015, bottle. brown and a bit hazy. nose is balsamic vinaigrette, sweet, mildly woody, slightly tart. thin body, dry, mildly fizzy. balsamic bite, woody, mildly sweet, dry finish. very good.

Bottle. Unclear brown with a large tan head. The nose has lots of barrel; oak, white wood, grapes, leather. All over the place. Taste is kind of strange. It is sour, but also fat which is an odd mix. It starts sour then turns sticky sweet and leaves a greasy mouthfeel. Flavour has some barnyard, band aid, oak, grain, hay, grapes, red apples. Long bretty and finish with oak notes. Too fat and greasy for me, but fun enough to try.

Bottle(vintage 2013):Ruby-amber coloured, hazy, mid-sized and slowly collapsing off-white loose head; balsamic vinegar, dried fruits and traces of barrique in the nose; moderate to solid sour-sweet flavour, medium bodied; lingering sour-vinegary and fruity finish , caramel barely detectable. A bavarian Red Sour Ale! Superb stuff
Amber coloured beer with off-white head. Aroma of red fruit. Taste is fresh fruity. Cherries with a sour undertone.

Bottle, assumedly fresh, drunk 8/15/15 at OEC Sour Fest. Listed as Aventinus Cuvee Barrique - weizenbock blended with eisbock and aged in Chardonnay barrels for 8 months.There were a lot of things to like about these sours/barrel-aged beers at OEC fest, comprised mostly of Italian and Belgian beer with a smattering of German ones. Unfortunately, a lot to dislike. Or perhaps Ive just grown out of really caring for a lot of particular barrel-aged beers. Like Spike and Jeromes, Dama a bruna, cuvee freddy, morpheus undressed and Abbaye de St. Bon Chien 2013, this was just another undercarbonated, oxidized, soggy, dull, grapey-fruity old barleywine-esque beer. Most of these or maybe all, were not over-barreled, which is admirable, but theyre just heavy, watery and provide so little in the way of brightness or levity on the palate. Sure, you may say, theyre more akin to drinking a good wine or port" but Im not trying to drink that, Im trying to drink a beer. Even the best imperial stouts, which arent exactly brimming with levity, still provide a good body, carbonation and balance/dryness. Really over these types of beers...

Bottle named Tap X Mein Aventinus Barrique (2014). A reddish brown beer, a head is small and beige. Aroma has berries and red currants, cherries, sourness, some earthyness, lether and dry barrel. Taste has cherries and berries, medium sourness, some wine vinegar, hint of fruitness of prunes. Medium bodied, not sticky, sparkling carbonation. This has nothing to do with weizenbock, more like as Sour/Flemish Red. Very confusing how mix of Aventinus and Aventinus Eisbock has been produced with aging this kind of beer which has no nuancees from original beers. Anyway, I like the style and also this beer is just great.

Really surprised by this one. Poured a slightly hazy orange with a white head. Aroma was of red wine, dark fruits, oak caramel and yeast. Flavor similar, wine barrel definitely plays a part here, woody and fruity. Highly complex.
Bottle shared. Brownish red pour. Aromas of sour dark fruits and berries. Taste is light sourness mixed with sweetness. Really well balanced.
Muddy brownish color with little foam. Sour smell. The taste is light, sour, a little malty with a thick full mouth feeling. Sour, dry and a little heavy aftertaste.

Bottle at SinH4?s Goodbye Event. Hints of vinegar in the aroma, but not in a stenchy way. Beautiful sourness and well balanced. Very distinct from the regular Aventinus Eisbock, and in a good way still!
Brown-reddish color with beige ring. Red berries, malts, tartness, berries, cherries funk. Taste is more of the same, vanilla and oak noticeable. A Flanders-red style Weizenbock? Amaaaazing!
Bottle. Dark reddish amber pour, slightly hazy, with an off white head. Sweet malt, raisin, dates, red berries, wood, and slightly sour. A pleasant beer, but it doesnt jump out at me as being great.

Bottle. Pours ugly murky reddish brown with non existing head. Surprisingly sour on the nose, tannins, wood, oaky vanilla, red wine, subtle malts, sweet fruits. Taste is quite sour and refreshing. Same as nose. Some bitter tannins in finish. Light body and tingling sour finish. A surprise, but e nice one!

Pours a dark ruby color with a small off-white head. Aromas of cherries, plums, figs, candied sugar, wood and booze. Flavors are along the same lines but I swear I can taste just a little of the banana/cloves from the original Weizen Bock from which it was aged. Fairly high carbonation with a sour/tart finish. This is by no means a Weizen Bock..........Ratebeer needs to re-classify this as a Sour/Flemish Red. Anyways, great beer.

375 ml bottle 2014 edition, from Bier-Deluxe.
Dark red body with a medium, quickly dissipating, fizzy, beige head.
Aroma with a lot of sweet, wooden barrel notes, vanilla, red wine, sweet-sour berries, overripe fruits, some ripe banana, some sweet malts.
Tastes delicious, quite sour, with barrel notes, vanilla, wine, overripe fruits, sweet-sour berries, apples, leather, even some barnyard notes, no Weizenbock notes at all.
Medium, a bit oily mouthfeel, with an average to soft carbonation.
Finishes smooth, sour, dry, wooden, fruity, a bit leathery, subtly alcohol warming.

Really surprising! As mentioned by others, this clearly is a Flemish Red and if I didnt know it I would never guess this is a barrel aged Aventinus. Very tasty, quaffable and greatly balanced, the alcohol is well hidden. Among my favourite Schneider Weisse beers and one of the best Sour Reds Ive had so far, even though it isnt categorised as such.

L:
-pours a murky brown with a small,creamy,quickly dissipating,beige head
-low-medium carbonation visible
S:
-oak,vanilla,grapes,overripe banana,caramel,toffee,balsamic vinegar

O:
Almost unrecognizable from its base Beers (Tap6 & Aventinus Eisbock).

Very good though.

Pours a surprisingly clear body (there goes my childhood wisdom about the unavoidable haziness of wheat beers), dark copper in colour, with a small head that leaves some lacing. Sour and strong aroma of tart fruits, red berries and cask wood. Complex and lovely strong flavour of acidic and tart fruits, tart red berries, red wine and cask wood. Moderate to light sweet and moderate sour taste. A brilliant beer! 
[75 cl bottle, labelled Schneider Weisse Tap X Mein Aventinus Barrique 2014, shared with Svensenga smak & behag, from Vinmonopolet Vika, Oslo]

Lovely nose: strawberry, cherry, raspberry and aceton. Lovely taste: oaky, cherry, ciric acid, vinegar, vanilla. Lovely mouthfeel. Lingering fruity aftertaste. Mjammie mjammie mjammie. 

Weisenbock? No. Vlaams Rood? Yes. Go for it if you like sours, avoid if else.

A hazed dark amber ale with a very thin off white head. In aroma, sweet fruity malt with dark fruits, prunes, light woody notes, very nice and smooth. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity malt with light licorice, light lactic notes, light woody notes, very nice and smooth. On tap at Farmhouse tap and Grill.

Bottle shared with daje, Simonsen & edvard at The "Esp0r #2000 Weekend in The Woods" 2014
Red, hazy, tanned head. Smell of ripe fruits, caramel, yeast esters, phenols, wheat. Moderate sweet, some aecidic acids, quite fruity, moderate sour, quite complex. Moderate bitter, fruit peel and red wine finish. As always a splendid beer from Schneider

Dark brown with a big tan head which dissipates somewhat quickly. Aroma is tart a little vinegary and oddly reminiscent of soy sauce. Flavor is tart and fruity with a fair amount of malt to bag it up. Just a little sweet in the finish though the aftertaste is mainly tartness. 

Wife: 3.8
Bottle, 750 ml from Svijet Piva, Zagreb. Pours hazy brown with off-white head. Caramel, dried fruits, spicy, woody, bit vinous. Expected better.

Bottle from bier-deluxe: Aroma with notes of cider, red wine, barrique, dark fruits, plums, berries, wheat, hops. Flavor is fruity, sourly with notes of red berries, red wine, very light bitter, astringent end.
Bottle at BFG15, masterclass. 6 months on pinot noir casks. Weizen to the darkr side, Wine is notably occurring, a bit krik like towards the finish. Nice one, but a strange combination.

Bottle from Coppers, Newcastle. A mahogany coloured beer that pours with no head at all. It has a tart, sour cherry flavour, warming strawberries, currants and sherry notes followed by digestive biscuit, cheesecake base and more cherries on the finish. Excellent!

Ambrée, sans carbo, petit collet fuyant.
Aromes puissant de bois, pomme verte, raisin et une pointe de cherry.
Vive et tres aigre sur lataque, on y retrouve en finale les notes de pomme verte acide et le cote boise.
Le taux dalcool ne se ressent pas sur le moment...

from draft, as vintage mein Aventinus Barrique 2013. poured a light muddy colour with a off head, vineous tart notes upfront, plums, green apples, grape, oak, some acid vinegar and some red cherries, some dry aftertaste with a small green apple in the aftertaste. bit more subtle and complex compared to the 14 version. glad to find it on tap. would never pay such a high price for a bottle. cant say its really worth a high price. compared to other BA beers.
Draft at Smoke and Barrel. Poured a clear amber brown color with a small white head. Aroma was light sweet caramel notes. Boozy notes. Flavor was caramel notes, sweet malts.
Bottle. Extremely cloudy, brown with hints of amber, with a small head. Very sour, funky aroma. Taste is very sour, with a funky after taste.

Light brown and opalescent colour with a fine lightly tan head. Noses of wood, sour red fruits with a pinch of caramel. Light lively, thin texture with a medium-full body. Sour bit tart with a faint sweetness. Excellently balanced with a lasting drying out finish at the back-end. Ace!

Geruch fruchtig und säuerlich, fast wie ein Sauerbier. Geschmack sehr sauer mit deutlichem Anklang von Bretannomyce, fruchtig. Kaum Malz oder Karamell.
Bin mir nicht sicher, ob das so geplant war, aber astrein für ein Sauerbier.

Geruch wie Sauerbier. Und ja, so auch im Geschmack. Blind würde ich sagen: Das ist eine Gueuze. Richtig trocken. Brett. Geilo.

Wenn ich die anderen Bewertungen lese, habe ich das Gefühl, dass in meiner Flasche eine Infektion war. Aber die hats nicht verschlechtert.

cloudy mahogany with a fizzy dusty-tan head, medium-fine, uniform, 5mm, moderate-fast rate of decay. A tart, lactic-acetic aroma hits me right away from afar - sour cherries. Close up, I get sour grape, light spiced raisin, and tingly vinegar. Body is highly oily, moderately starchy, very smooth and viscous, moderate weight, light, medium-fine carbonation with little-to-no burn. Flavor is tart, much less acetic, lightly spicy, cherry, grape, unripe mango, a bit of brown sugar under it all, and a hint of molasses. Not getting a lot of the typical weizenbock flavors, or even dark flavors at all. I think all of the caramel malt were consumed by the souring organisms of those Chardonnay barrels. Overall: does not taste at all like a bock of any sort (-1 overall for no heads up on the tartness.) As a Flanders brown, pleasant, smooth, with less bite - first rate!  Aside: for those of you describing this as Brett, I would think twice.  This is much cleaner than most Brett Ive encountered, so perhaps we are dealing with bacteria.

text: Appearance: muddy purple brown with a quickly retreating light tan head.  Aroma: strong aroma of sour cherries and raspberries, with brown bread, caramel, graham cracker pie crust, and a bit of vanilla. I loved this beer so much I became its Godfather...no, seriously- I really did! See here for proof of this awesome German title for beer lovers: http://www.biertraum.de/tapx-mein-aventinus-barriq is called "Pate" in German, hence "Bier Pate"). Nonetheless, this beer is able to offer something you really cant refuse- so make sure you share it or youll end up pretty tipsy...and yes, Im speaking from experience here. So on to the taste: its almost as if a Belgian Quadrupel produced a love baby with a really flavorful Geuze, and the baby inherited the best of both their traits. A complex beer that changes its profile as you work your way through it, which is when you truly start to appreciate its complexity and smooth finish. Sadly, its another one of their "limited edition" beers, so once its gone, it really is Auf Wiedersehen for good. So if you find it, then do yourself a favor and buy two because "Mein Aventinus Barrique" has AGE ME written all over it, and will only get more fantastic with each year.
